conclusion: Use principles of ideal gas behavior and relationship between internal energy, temperature, and work done.
State A: pressure p0, volume V0; State C: pressure 0.6p0, volume 0.5V0.
Use equation of state for ideal gas: pV = nRT.
Temperature T is constant, ratio of volumes V0/0.5V0 = 2.
Calculate number of moles n using ideal gas law: n = p0V0/RT0.
Change in volume from B to C is 0.5V0 - 2V0 = -1.5V0.
Internal energy U is given by U = aT, temperature T is constant.
Work done by gas is equal to change in internal energy.
Work done by gas from state B to state C is -0.9V0p0.
Substitute given values into equation to find work done: -0.9V0p0.
Work done by gas is equal to change in internal energy.
Work done by gas when it changes from state B to state C is -0.9V0p0.
